label: 太宰府
本: Capital and Countryside in Japan, 300-1180:  Japanese Historians Interpreted in English . Cornell University East Asia Program . 2006
説明文: the Kyûshû headquarters, in the province of Chikuzen near present-day Hakata. It was charged with oversight of all the provinces of Kyûshû and the two islands of Iki and Tsushima, greeting foreign emissaries, overseeing foreign visitors, and defending the realm against external enemies.
